entry.et: Middle English permitten, from Latin permittere to let through, permit, from per- through + mittere to let go, send

def.dt: :to consent to expressly or formally permit access to records
:to make possible the design permits easy access
:to give an opportunity :allow if time permits
:a written warrant or license granted by one having authority a gun permit

entry.et: perhaps by folk etymology from Spanish palometa, a kind of pompano, from diminutive of paloma dove, from Latin palumba, palumbes palomino

def.dt: :either of two pompanos (Trachinotus falcatus and T. goodei) that are important game fishes of temperate to tropical waters of the western Atlantic
